articles.author: Associated Press
articles.title: Man sentenced in death of boater on trip to pour dad's ashes
articles.description: Robert Louis, 59, of Lake Orion died in August after he and several others fell out of the wooden kit boat near Au Train in Michigan's Upper Peninsula.

articles.author: http://www.dailymail.co.uk/home/search.html?s=&authornamef=Anneta+Konstantinides, By Anneta Konstantinides and Jennifer Smith For Dailymail.com
articles.title: Detroit teen who wrote 'next school shooter' on Instagram arrested
articles.description: Jacob Graham was charged on Monday with false report or threat of terrorism, a felony. He was arrested after a parent saw the post and notified Chippewa Valley High School.

articles.description: Follow the StarTribune for the news, photos and videos from the Twin Cities and beyond.

articles.author: By THOMAS PLANK Missoulian
articles.title: Native American man fosters healing, understanding
articles.description: MISSOULA, Mont. (AP) — Bridges are the sinew that holds Missoula together. They cross the Clark Fork River throughout town, but are so commonly used that they are almost invisible because they're so important.

articles.author: PRI's The World
articles.title: Oklahoma has the highest rate of imprisoned women in the US — but one county is remarkably reversing the trend
articles.description: Oklahoma has the highest rate of female incarceration in the country, a rate that continues to go up in every part of the state except for in Tulsa County. One organization seems to have a major effect on the county's statistics — Women in Recovery is an 18-m…

articles.author: Milwaukee Journal Sentinel, Patrick Marley, Milwaukee Journal Sentinel
articles.title: Lawsuit alleges Wisconsin officials knew fee for DNA database was unconstitutional but imposed it anyway
articles.description: A new lawsuit that could cost taxpayers millions of dollars says the state forced more than 10,000 offenders to pay an unconstitutional fee to maintain a DNA database.

articles.author: BRETT FRENCH french@billingsgazette.com
articles.title: Crow tribal member found guilty of illegal elk killing appeals to U.S. Supreme Court
articles.description: A Crow tribal hunter has asked the U.S. Supreme Court to review his treaty rights case.

articles.author: Vianna Davila
articles.title: Native Americans, Seattle’s original residents, are also its most likely to be homeless.
articles.description: The city is trying to fix that disparity, but there are obstacles — one of them a Civil Rights-era, fair housing law.

articles.description: JANESVILLE, Wis. (AP) — The chubby Boston terrier named Miss Ella bustles around the grounds of the Red Road House. She is a joy, and she is a reminder of sorrow, the Janesville Gazette reported. Someone stepped on her head some years ago, making her deaf, bu…

articles.title: Four years of Dateline's Missing in America: 90 still missing
articles.description: Read, and share, their stories. Someone, somewhere, saw something. If you know someone who is missing, send us a message on Facebook or email dateline.contactus.@nbcuni.com.
